intro: Clibadium sodiroi, commonly known as the Brazilian burr bean, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers followed by distinctive, spiny pods that contain edible seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and potential nutritional value, it has been studied for its ecological and agricultural significance.
